required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prognostic Value of the 6-minute Stepper Test in Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Prognostic Value of the 6-minute Stepper Test in Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the predictive interest of the 6-minute stepper test in preoperative thoracic surgery. The goal is through this test to determine the risk of postoperative complications.

primary_outcome.measure: occurrence of a post-operative complication grade â‰¥ 2 on the Clavien-Dindo scale within three months after surgery

clinical_study.condition: To Evaluate the Predictive Performance of the 6-minute Stepper Test on the Risk of Complications

intervention.description: The patient carries out the two tests before surgery then we observe the occurrence of postoperative complications

study_pop.textblock: On the day of the surgical consultation, the patient is informed of the modalities of the study by the thoracic surgeon and collects his non-opposition of participation. It is also evaluated by a physiotherapist, who supervises the realization of 6MST and STST.
